name: Pope Lucius III
summary: Lucius III, born Ubaldo Allucingoli, was Pope from 1181 to 1185. He had conflicts with Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa over the control of Italian territories. He held the Third Lateran Council in 1179, which established procedures for papal elections requiring a two-thirds majority. He worked to combat heresy and issued decrees against the Waldensians and Cathars. His pontificate was marked by ongoing tensions between the papacy and the empire.
